openness.description: Openness to Experience - intellectual curiosity and aesthetic appreciation

conscientiousness.description: Conscientiousness - organization, self-discipline, and goal achievement

extraversion.description: Extraversion - social energy, assertiveness, and positive emotions

neuroticism.description: Neuroticism - emotional instability, anxiety, and stress response

factorAnalysisRequirements.independence: Each factor should be relatively independent (r < 0.7 between factors)
factorAnalysisRequirements.reliability: Factor loadings should exceed 0.4 for factor membership
factorAnalysisRequirements.variance: Five factors should explain minimum 60% of total personality variance

establishedCorrelations.researchBasis: Meta-analysis shows consistent negative correlation (Roberts et al., 2007)
establishedCorrelations.validationRule: High conscientiousness (>80) should not combine with very high neuroticism (>85)
Very high extraversion (>85) with very low agreeableness (<20) should trigger review

establishedCorrelations.researchBasis: Generally independent factors with weak positive correlation
establishedCorrelations.validationRule: No strong constraints - both can vary independently

establishedCorrelations.researchBasis: Weak negative correlation - extraverts tend to be more emotionally stable
establishedCorrelations.validationRule: Very high neuroticism (>90) with very high extraversion (>85) is unusual

allTraitsExtreme.description: Probability of all five traits above 90th percentile

allTraitsLow.description: Probability of all five traits below 10th percentile

oppositeExtremes.description: Traits at opposite extremes (e.g., one >85, another <15)

neuroticism.explanation: Identity formation and life transitions increase anxiety

openness.explanation: Highest openness typically in early adulthood

warnings.message: Unusually high conscientiousness and low neuroticism for age group

neuroticism.explanation: Emotional stability typically increases with age

customer_service.reasoning: Customer service requires social skills and emotional stability

technical_advisor.reasoning: Technical roles require attention to detail and problem-solving

creative_collaborator.reasoning: Creative roles require innovation and collaborative communication

project_manager.reasoning: Management requires organization, leadership, and emotional stability

diversityRequirements.openness: Teams benefit from mix of high and moderate openness
diversityRequirements.extraversion: Balance of extroverts and introverts improves dynamics
diversityRequirements.agreeableness: Minimum 40% of team should have agreeableness >60

problematicCombinations.issue: High team anxiety may reduce performance
problematicCombinations.suggestion: Include at least one emotionally stable member

problematicCombinations.issue: Low team cooperation may cause conflicts
problematicCombinations.suggestion: Include at least one highly agreeable member

collectivist.description: Cultures emphasizing group harmony and interdependence

validationAdjustments.agreeableness: Values 40-60 may be appropriate vs. individual culture norms

individualist.description: Cultures emphasizing personal achievement and independence

considerationFlags.flag: Very high extraversion may be culturally inappropriate

singlePersonality.description: Individual personality validation should complete within 50ms

batchValidation.description: Batch validation should maintain per-item performance

complexValidation.description: Multi-dimensional validation with cultural and developmental factors

accuracyRequirements.description: Validation should correctly identify invalid patterns while minimizing false flags

PRECISION_VIOLATION.actionRequired: Round to 2 decimal places with warning

BUSINESS_RULE_VIOLATION.description: Personality incompatible with intended agent role

DEVELOPMENTAL_MISMATCH.description: Traits unusual for specified age group
